column4: washburnello: when i installed ubuntu, i di a clean wipe of windows, later i began looking thru all the fiels and folders in ubuntu to learn it, it was then i noticed that i supposedly have 3 computere in my network. i did not set up a network and we only have 2 computers and i never connected them notr so i even no how to do that?
what kind of computer are you using? is it a laptop?
do the names of the computers look familure?
the reason I'm asking these kinds of questions is because networks can be very complex
does your home network have wifi?
it's probably just residual information in the router
when did you install ubuntu?
yeah, it's probably just residual
I wouldn't worry about it
wouldn't hurt anything to check
networks can be very complex. without an extensive knowledge of your setup it's hard to be certain.
do you have a router and more than 1 computer connecting to the internet at home?
than you have a network. Thats what a network is. what your referring to not setting up is file sharing or something like it.
when you went to "network" in ubuntu, it's just showing you that it detected the presence of other computers on your network.
dns
it's all part of how networking works
hit up wikipedia about networking sometime. there's loads of stuff there. :)
that was the old days ;)
I'd also do some research on tightening up your wireless just as a preemptive measure.
I don't think it's your problem but it's always a good idea
:D
what your laptop is sensing is other networks. your router doesn't connect to routers wirelessly unless you have a special scenerio
later
